review: Food good. (Cobb salads) Beer cold. Service good.  BUT YOUR COFFEE MACHINE IS BROKEN?????  Go out and buy a freakin Mr Coffee!!! You're a restaurant and people want coffee for crying out loud!

You can't beat a $6 Long Island and endless apps.  This is a good place to just go chill and catch up with your people. Our server Jordan was very attentive to us even while sitting in the bar area. Oh and I almost forgot there's always some cool vibing music in the background. Super cool experience altogether

The commercial was for a full rack of ribs for a special price. When the dish came I noticed that the length was a full rack however the width was a little smaller than other places. I got the BBQ sauce but they had a couple of other options available, including one with bacon. They weren't fall off the bone but not tough at all. Also the pit stop skins were delicious. The bacon was NOT bacon bits but freshly cut bacon. The server was busy but friendly and nice.

I had gotten their new Mac n cheese burger and  would have to give them kudos. Once I received the burger, I was surprised that it actually look like the burger. The only thing I didn't like about it is, is that it was over cooked. I felt like it needed some sort of special sauce on it because it tasted a bit dry. Also, we ordered a spinach dip with chips and it was delicious but they should consider giving more chips then just half a hand full. Overall the service was great!

Visited this restaurant today because of the recent TV ads for ribs.  I had the Big Ribs.  It was fall off the bone and there were several options for sauce. I chose Memphis and ended up taking half home.  Opted for broccoli instead of fries and it was great, not over cooked.   Our server was excellent and overall it was a great experience.

5/18 Our little boy, who seems to exist solely on "chicken and fries", announced that he wanted to go to Fridays for "noodles."  My husband and I were in such shock we couldn't argue so we found this one on our way out of Atlanta. I prefer to go places we don't have back home, but it was actually kind of fun to compare this Fridays to ours back home. I've been a Rewards member for ages and with that you get free chips and salsa.  At home, you get a tiny little cup of salsa that runs out after two chips.  Here in Kennesaw, we got a small bowl.  It was awesome.  Everyone got salsa for more than a single chip! :)   Our server was really friendly and attentive.  I got one of the new bacon burgers, kiddo got his noodles, and my Cajun-pasta-loving spouse switched it up on us and got a salad with strawberries and chicken.  The food was fantastic.  Exactly what we've come to expect from Friday's. The only real issue we had was that my husband wanted a beer and they were out of nearly everything and then they were switching the keg on one.  He finally ended up with something half way through his lunch.  To compensate, though, they only charged us for the smaller pint glass. It was a really nice atmosphere and had nice décor.  It was actually pretty nice to stick with something familiar.

I grew up in the area so over the course of approximately 10-12 years, I've spent over a $1000 dollars at this location - EASILY.  I moved out of state after grad school and met up with my family at this location a little over a month ago. It was the ABSOLUTE worst service I've ever experienced in this restaurant. One person in our party (of only four) ordered unlimited appetizers and it was slow getting them out to the table & even getting the order correct.  After asking for a booth, we were seated near the bar instead with a black female waitress whose attitude was atrocious. (I wish I could remember her name.) After all the Cajun Chicken and Shrimp I've ordered from Friday's, I will not be visiting this location anytime soon.  My advice is to wipe it all out and start over. TGIF's already seems to be going out of business more and more, and this one looks like it's on its way out. If I were the manager of this place, I'd be embarrassed and mortified!

Used to love fridays!  Still like the fried green beans....but this trip there was awful. Waitress was friendly but they were extremely slow in everything  Didn't seem over crowded to expect it to be that way.  Food was mediocre at the least. Prices were too much for what we got. My husband got a burger....said steak and shake would have been better!

It was awful. Our waitress was never around, our drinks were never refiled. THEN on top of that, our breadsticks tasted like Chinese egg rolls??? I was very, very confused. She also got our order wrong, and all of the waiters and waitresses were just standing around not helping anyone, yet they were singing and having a good time while our food was still not out and our drinks were still not refilled! And our waitress who was never there I say again, had the nerve to ask us if we wanted our change back, we had at least $20 in change, did she really think she was going to get a $20 tip for her poor service??? The only good thing about it was the shrimp scampi pasta and the french fries were delicious. However the service here sucks.The waiters were also sitting around and ordering food and eating, I just didn't understand that because our table still didn't have food and I had to go to another table to get ketchup because our's was empty. Way too overstaffed to have such bad service.

They have "endless apps" for $12 and you can switch it up and get a new app after you finish each plate. My wife had endless apps and I had a burger. We both enjoyed the food. We had a very nice and pretty waitress named "Sugar" and she was awesome. If you have been to a TGI Fridays then you know what to expect. Next time I go back I will try the endless apps. They looked good. But I usually get filled up real fast.
Ridiculously dirty and horrible staff.   Loud DJ and host was eating at his stand.  Bartenders didn't bother to wipe the Mayo and beer off the bar.  Won't go back.

First let me say, I had not been into a TGIF in such a long time. Where I live, they closed it down so when I had the opportunity to come to this one in Kennesaw, I jumped right on it.  I am only giving this location a 4 star instead of a 3 star because of the experience I had. Me and my family were greeted by the best waiter. I can't remember his name but it started with a "Z" and it was not a common name. He said he had just turned 21. He is probably the only guy that works there with a name starting with a Z.   He smiled and attended to us just the right amount of times and you could tell that he enjoyed his job. Heck, if he didn't enjoy it, he fooled us. He was that good! You know you are good when you put smiles on a 12 year old's face.  This guy was super awesome.   The food was just okay. I was not impressed. It did not taste how it used to taste. I ordered a fried shrimp with fries and I've had better. However, I would totally give this location another chance if I am in the city because of the waiter. And I would definitely go for drinks.
Piss poor service, dirty glasses, long wait for food, and no silverware... pathetic...

Wait time here for food and drinks is ridiculous. We asked for a booth but none were available. We waited at the bar. When the hostess came to get us she tried to sit us at a table. Duh!! Manager came out to tell us that our food was coming and apologized,  only after the server already did that. This place needs a huge management and staff overhaul!  And we were there so long that they brought a DJ in that played the music so loud that you couldn't hear each other.  Who brings in a DJ at 8pm in a restaurant! We are NOT coming back!
Food sat getting cold fries where double dipped in the grease and waited 15 mins before I finally got a refill on my drink. This place needs to be closed and new staff and management brought in.

I've been to this location several times but looks like management has changed or something . Kitchen was super slow, waitress was not very attentive. The food was average at best We had another waiter in our section that checked in with us more than she did. It wasn't very busy at all ! My friend ordered wings that seemed to have miss the sauce and my burger didn't come out until 10 minutes after her wings. No apologies from our server at all.

By far the most disappointing TGI Friday's location I've ever been to. When we arrived, there were 4 people in the dining room. The hostess took us to a table and we asked if we could please have a booth instead. So she said "I guess" & took us to a half table half booth. Fine, although there were plenty of empty booths in the restaurant at the time. The table next to us had an issue with their food which was our first indication that this place wouldn't be the best. We ordered appetizers and entree, but I told the server I didn't want the entree until we were finished with our apps. They came out at the same time, of course. But, we managed, no big deal. We noticed how slowly kitchen items were coming out and we're surprised since the restaurant was so slow. At one point a police officer came in to ask some questions, and once he left you could hear a member of the staff shout "Woohoo! I'm not going to jail today!" Totally unprofessional, as was the table full of serving staff and a manager sitting around on their phones near the bar. Will not be returning.

Took 10 minutes to be seated even though there were tons of open tables and no line.  Then no one came to our table while we waited another ten minutes while watching the waitresses talk and play in the back.  When we got up to leave after tiring of waiting and he waitress did not apologize but try to argue that we would not want to leave. The manager than just said have a great day without even understanding what was going on. I will not be going here again

Oh my goodness all I can say is "soooooo good!!". I placed an to-go order because I had a few friends coming over and when I tell you that EVERYTHING was good, I mean EVERYTHING. The ribs were so tender, the chicken was really fresh, the appetizers (potato skins, cheese sticks, potstickers, and pretzel sticks) were outstanding. I have no complaints.

This use to be my go to place, but lately it has been going down hill.  The manager and staff both need retraining in my humble opinion.  The server was rule, indifferent, and didn't know the menu items.  She only checked on us at the end of our meal and forgot to bright us several items we requested and got our order wrong.    The manager was setting there the whole time not paying any attention to the servers.  When I complained to the manager, she was friendly and tried to make things right by giving me a discount.   Since my dining experience had been ruined, what good is the discount?  I would prefer great service and great food discounting a ruined meal!

I have not been in a T.G.I. Friday's in years!  Decided to not hit the usual Chili's and give it another shot.  Mmmmm, no not mmm as in good.  It is still ho hum corny stuff with lots of marketing.  The kids menu is the usual.  The good meatless salad was simple but still $8 so on a dime you'd have to go with the house salad which was sad but at least it was $4. I'm guess it will be another five years before a return unless the logo explosion goes away.  I didn't see Jack Daniels written as much in their own distillery. Big thumbs up on the black bean burger though!

The bartender walked by twice, while looking at us and did not ask us for an order. Finally a manager came over and asked if we had been served. She even seemed annoyed. They brought our food with no silverware. We asked for silverware and did not receive any for another 5 min.  I will not be coming back to this excuse for a restaurant.

I have been to this location twice this month. Both times were about the same. We were seated quickly and our waitress was there not long after.  My daughter and our creatures of habit. I got the turkey burger and she got a beef burger. Our food came out fast. We both agreed that the burgers were delicious. The waitress was very attentive and served us well. Overall I would say my experiences were great.

Fast friendly service. Food is good. It is what you expect at Fridays. I had one of the signature burgers last time I was there. It was cooked perfect and delicious. The fries were nice and crispy. We also had the pretzel and cheese dip and that was fantastic.  The only thing I don't like is that the place is always packed every time I go. But that just means lots of people like the place.

My mother and I have given this place more than enough chances, but after our most recent visit I can honestly say that they have no more chances; we're done with TGI Friday's. The food has been up and down there for years and my first visit there back when I was a kid should've been a sign of things to come; I asked for a burger well done and got the equivalent of a burnt piece of charcoal. We went back for the first time in many years a year or two ago and it was decent, so we thought they had gotten their act together; but alas, we were wrong again. But our most recent visit was easily one of the worst meals we've ever eaten. I had the korean steak tacos and my mom had the bruschetta chicken pasta. The pasta was overcooked, the sauce was weird, and the chicken was dried out and burnt; but the tacos took the cake. They came out with a bunch of stuff on them that wasn't on the menu listing and looked absolutely unappetizing; but they smelled even worse. The best way to describe the smell is rotten garbage and it made my stomach turn, but I decided to take at least one bite because sometimes things can smell bad but taste good; this however, was not one of those times. I spit the bite I took out faster than a bullet leaving the chamber of a gun; it was absolutely disgusting and made me instantly nauseous. And the rice that came as a side with it wasn't much better; it tasted like it was cooked in some sort of chemical solution. Sadly, I think the problem isn't just with this restaurant in particular; i think it's a problem with the company itself. Their food just doesn't cut it and I think they know it considering how they hired Guy Fieri to endorse their stuff (which lasted about a month and I'm betting it ended after he actually tried their food) and how they've used multiple food competition shows to come up with new menu items. It's sad to say, but I don't see the company lasting much longer with the quality of food their serving. In short, I can't recommend TGI Friday's to anyone, except someone I didn't overly like; but even then i would feel bad. Just avoid this craptastic chain and their sucky food.

I am a new resident to the Kennesaw area. Visited once soon after my arrival, and I was not impressed. Decided to try again, now six months later.  Bad decision.  Tough beef.  Crappy sandwiches. Mediocre service.  We won't be returning for a third try.

Called at 5:30 Saturday to ask if they were busy while I was in parking lot. I was with my sister and they said they weren't busy for 2 people. We walked in got seated right away. I ordered a 6oz steak with mashed potatoes and steak fries. My sister got the spicy craft beer-cheese burger.. Both cooked well done. 30 minute wait til our food came out. My steak tasted good but it wasn't juicy. The Parmesan steak fries had like weird juice around it and on it.. I guess it's oil. It makes it look gross. It was ok but I wouldn't go back because it wasn't great or special.

We've had excellent service the two times we've been here. Sadly that is probably the best part to report about.  The food is overpriced and not anything to rave about. The only one I've come to like is their Jack Daniel's Chicken and Shrimp, I can't get enough of that Jack Daniel's sauce!

Enjoyed our night out thanks to the (genuinely) friendly staff tonight at TGI Fridays. The hostess, expos and especially our server KAY were all great! Food was yummy, so was the Bloody Mary :) But I really appreciates Kay's positive, helpful and friendly attitude... Very refreshing :) and I'm a fellow server and very picky about servers.... So that should say a lot
They closed 30 minutes early compared to what they should've. Thirty minutes. I understand 5 minutes, but 30 is ridiculous. Wow.

Bar none the worst food and service in north Ga. Potato skins were just out of the freezer cold, fried green beans were so tough needed a knife to cut them. Only one person working the bar so service was bad . When he came to the table I asked for the check and told him that someone needs to tell the kitchen manager that food should be served hot heck warm may have been good. Then the manager came to the table and asked what was wrong. Never again

The bar tender here sucks. The guy is such a jerk. Walked in maybe an hour before they close he screamed "man why the **** do I always get these late night people" we thought he was just having a bad day went again 3 days later he was slow and rude and never checked up on us. We went back made sure we where not sat with him our server told us that he is always in a bad mood. And that he is extremely rude... besides all that. The other girl serve we had was amazing super attentive and friendly and food was just like any other Friday and billions in chain restaurants in Kennesaw. Only go as a last resort.
Service was good but the food was sub par. Grilled chicken was so tough, it was not edible.

My family and I have been eating at this location for several years. Recently over the past year this place has turned into a trashy dump. They now play live "R&B" music at night and have a very "Ghetto" atmosphere.  My last two visits my wife and I have recieved horrible service (caucasian) while others (african americans) are being taken care of. If I wanted service like this I would eat in marietta. NEVER AGAIN.

Havent been here in years. Now, i remember why!!!! I will start by telling the good things about the place.  Great waitstaff, decent food. Ok, now the bad....  i got the soup and half sandwich which was good BUT, the sandwich was BARELY 3 bites.... $9 NOT including drink!! Its a crying shame when u spend that much and  you r still hungry(and im an average sized person)!!!! Sandwich was SMALLER than u see on kids meals... and im NOT exaggerating at all.... i wont b back...

Chain restaurants are not created equal. Salmon was smaller than what im used to but it was delicious. The shrimp were piping hot. The mashed potatoes were on point...but the smell of the sour beer from the bar was a bit of a turnoff.

Just want to give a shout out to Kandris and the GM at this store.  Had dinner there Friday night and they replaced my husband's fish without us even asking - the piece they served was tiny and he wasn't really happy about it but had decided to let it go.  Kandris must have noticed it too and came back and picked it up and got him a new one.  Gm came over and checked on it as well.  Don't have my receipt to do the customer survey but wanted to give them a shout out.  Love their potstickers - that's the main reason we go.  However, the broccoli soup SUCKS!!!!  Has the consistency of spit.  Not sure what cheese they're using in it (tastes a bit like swiss) but between the consistency and it being way too salty, it was disgusting.  However, the other food was great.  Will not be ordering that soup again.  Can remember this TGIF's being really bad about 5 years ago but we've had a couple of good experiences there since then - seems like the management's doing a good job now.  We'll be back.

Went here for my son's Birthday dinner.  The service was good and the loaded skillet chips nachos were excellent.  I had the Korean Steak Tacos, and they were not that great.  I think no one would miss them if they took them off the menu.  All in all, a decent experience.
Good food. Amazing service! We asked for napkins, and instantly, another waiter at an adjacent table turned around and handed them. Very impressed by service.

Love this place.  Great drinks, great service... I recommend the Bruschetta Chicken Pasta - of course, being a vegetarian, I order it sans chicken... and they have never brought it with chicken, which is huge if you're a veggie. Another favorite is their broccoli cheese soup.  Great desserts, too!
Food was terrible! I can make a better Jack Daniels ribeye steak, and sizzlin chicken and shrimp than who ever the cook was when I went!

Fridays is Fridays.  Kennesaw to Connecticut.  Seattle to Souix Falls.  They are all essentially the same, and that's part of the deal.  You know what you're going to get. Fridays burgers and fries are tasty and good and a go-to fave of mine.  Service is helpful and generally efficient at this location. This Kennesaw store is tucked in the front corner of a shopping center and a little difficult to see and get to.  Make a right turn into the gas station just off I75, or go beyond the gas station to the corner where the Target is and turn right.  Make another right and you're there. Live music plays in a corner of the bar on select nights, a unique feature of this particular Fridays.

I've always enjoyed the food, atmosphere and staff at TGI Friday's. However, the new id policy- no vertical id's- is not a great decision. If I am 21, and have chosen not to pay exorbitant fees to get my id flipped, I shouldn't have to bring my passport or a fake id to drink. While management was very respectful and I understand the rash of underage drinkers coming through, I strongly encourage the Atlanta TGI Friday's franchisee to reconsider their decision of preventing individuals- who are OF AGE and have presented proper legal photo identification clearly showing legal age- from drinking. You will lose business, and you're encouraging me to break the law to have what would have been a legal drink with my meal.
They totally saved a very pregnant woman's life in the middle of the night. The sampler was exactly what I needed; potato skins, green beans and mozzarella sticks... Mmmm

This Friday's was very clean and had a nice ambience. I don't really eat at chains all that much and hadn't been to a TGI Fridays in yrs due to food poisoning at another location. I am happy to report this one didn't make me sick and their signature dishes were just as expected. Yes, we came for the Jack Daniels sauce so feel free to pour it on my salad or even on my mashed potatoes. The service was good and the food arrived promptly.

Before about a year ago, this place was fine. fast service and good food. Now its a different story. a few months ago my whole family went to eat here (6 people) and our service was terrible. I ordered a vodka cran and my brother ordered a beer. our server came back with waters all around, and left. didnt see her for 30 min, and then our COLD appetizers came, which we sent back immediately. still no alcohol at the table 45 min later. my brother went to the EMPTY bar, ordered and paid for his beer there, and came back to the table.  our drinks then arrived with our entrees and remade apps, and our server asked where the beer came from, the apologized because the bar was 'very busy'. yea, except there was no customers at the bar and not a lot of tables in the restaurant. my drink was weak and tasted like cran, but at this point, i didnt care and just wanted to eat and leave.  half way through our meal, two bussers came with buckets and started picking things up off our table, asking us if we were done. I dont think so, we all still had more than half  our entrees!  we asked for to go boxes and left.  round two, a few months later we decided to try it again, but sat at the bar. bar tender took 10 min to make a long island in front of me. because he was too busy talking to his gf. me and my gf were the only other people there! our food took exceptionally long too, but at least it wasnt cold like last time.  Wont ever go back. shame, me and my gf used to go there every friday after work too.

Came for some appetizers late. Sat at the bar and everything started out fine, but after 10 minutes no bartender to be found and waited over 20 minutes for appetizers. We were the only ones at the bar. Will not be coming again.
So I found out Eli isn't fired...he just gave me my life with this long island! !! Yeah drink on point ...food yummy! !! Great service. ..
Regular chain restaurant, nothing special. They do have some good drink specials on certain weekdays so make sure to check that out.
This place is a hot mess. Disorganized and seems like they have no clue what they are doing.  Waited 30 mins before they figured out they forgot to put in our food.

Don't waste your time here. The service is the absolute worst that I've ever experienced. We sat for 20 minutes waiting for a server, only to have her bring us our drinks and appetizer(which was unlimited) and never come and ask us how our food was. Our drinks sat empty and the sad part was they weren't busy at all. So disappointed in this place. We won't be back.

Food was AAAAA+ our server Trevor was extra nice and attentive . My family will be back soon . This was one of our best experiences at Friday's since the remodel . Prices we're fair . Only thing I'd like to see would be more local craft beers on tap.

This is a great place to catch up with friends, especially on a Wednesday. They have the $3 martinis. Not a bad deal, plus right now they have an endless appetizer for $12. This promotion is per person. But there isn't a stipulation on sharing.

The welcome was awesome as there were 4 hostesses but it went downhill from there. After sitting at our table for over 5 minutes, we looked up and saw at least 4 servers standing around but none of them seem interested in serving anyone. After walking up and asking a hostess for service, our waitress arrived. She took our drink order but we had to ask if she would go ahead and take our order (based on our wait and the fact that our menus were closed, she should have asked if we'd like to place our food order at the same time as our drink order). We ordered a tall Tanqueray and Tonic, emphasis on "tall". The drink came in a highball glass. We were charged for the extra tonic so have to blame that one on the bartender.  The manager came over and apologized for everything and promised us  a discount on our meal. Of course that didn't happen either. I like the menu and the food was OK, but the lack of attention to the guests is why we won't go back.
Great service!! Great food/drink!! Lovely setting!! Friendly staff... Special thanks to my server Noah and the manager Matt. Sunday 9/21/14
This is the only location we go to.  I usually go to non-franchise restaurants.  When we go here, the service and food is good.  No complaints.
I wouldn't even give it a star but at least the server was friendly when she took FOREVER to take are order, get our drinks, everything was slooooowwwww. Food wasn't worth the wait.

I'm truly astonished by some of the unfavorable reviews this establishment has received as that has not been my experience at all and I drop by often.  This location serves a mixed crowd as does most of the Greater Atlanta area.  I've been there on Thursdays when they have a small band and it's not "Ghetto" as someone stated. I have to give props to Ken, the bartender who makes my favorite drink, Strawberry Shortcake consistently, delectably delicious each time I visit.  It's one of those drinks that, if you don't follow the recipe in the book, can turn out tasting a bit off.  Ken makes it perfect each time and I firmly believe that consistency is one of the signs of a great restaurant.  TGIF's may want to put the drink back on the regular menu as, when it came out, their female customers were asking me the name of the drink.  Some of us women do have a sweet tooth and hiding it away in the bartender's book limits the drink options for women.  We're usually lucky enough to get Erica as our server, who knows our favorite menu and drink items by heart and warmly greets us each time we visit.  She is very attentive to her customer's needs and quickly delivers the goods. TGIF has a great menu where you can drop by for a quick bite and drink, offering 3 appetizers for $15, all offerings very tasty, leaving you with a desire to return and order them again.  Their full menu is equally appealing. In closing, I just want to say that Ken and Erica's joy in their job is evident in the way in which they masterfully handle a multitude of tasks in a busy environment with a smile on their face and a care for the customer.  Exemplary!
Food is always up to par for a chain restaurant but the service has never been good. So I refuse to go to this location anymore.

Ok, service...well, we had a waiter more interested in someone being arrested across the street. I love equality, but this guy's treatment between my wife and I, caucasion and other customers, African American was nothing equal AT ALL ....Racism can go any way.....and tonight, it was heavy.

Had not been to a TGI Fridays in years and years...used to love them when I lived in VABeach.  Went at 2 in the afternoon, so getting a table was not a problem. Service was attentive and everyone was polite.  Was shocked at the prices on the menu...for a chain restaurant that doesn't really specialize in anything, they had the prices of a fine-dining steak place!  Appetizers ran around $10 and meals ran close to $20...for chain food??!??!  We decided to get appetizers as we didn't want to spend $50+ at a TGIFridays.  Co-foodie got the mozzarella sticks.  They were good and you got 6 of them...but they were $9. I just bought a box of them at Kroger (TGIFriday brand; exact same cheese sticks) for $5.  Not even any garnish...just a tiny amount of either marinara or honey mustard. They were hot and cheesy and tasty, just not $9 worth (plus tax and tip!).  I ordered the 3-dip appetizer.  You got a basket of tortilla strips and 3 dips...hummus, salsa, and cheese dip.  The chips were almost inedible...some were crispy, some were so chewy that you could not bite off a piece.  The salsa had a really good flavor, but was as thin as water so you really couldn't scoop it onto a chip.  I love hummus and hummus is NOT hard to make...but they had so much garlic (and don't get me wrong, I LOVE garlic) that you couldn't eat it. You couldn't taste lemon, you couldn't taste olive oil, you couldn't even taste chickpeas...all you could taste was garlic.  The cheese dip was barely room temperature, so I sent it back. It was returned slightly warm (still not hot). I didn't feel like sending it back again and couldn't eat the hummus and sure couldn't fill up on the runny salsa, so decided to eat it even though it was barely warm.  Then found out that it, also, was inedible...it was SWEET! What on earth do you put in a jalapeno cheese dip that is sweet?!?  Bizarre.  When the server came to clear the table and asked how everything was (my plate was still very obviously full), I told him how disappointed I was in mine and he just apologized...with no offer to comp it. Unusual since I had barely touched it...it's not like I had eaten it all and THEN complained...salsa, hummus, and cheese were all almost full.  I could have complained to the manager, but just didn't want the hassle.  The server should have offered (unless they are not allowed to).  All in all, will not be back.  For those prices, everything should have been way ABOVE good...the food should have been +++++++....but it didn't even come close.
Cool place and very friendly staff.  I've always been a fan of the Jack Daniels marinated meals.

This restaurant sends me frequent emails about their "Stripes" program. So I went last week with my family (have never had a good experience here, but there's always hope?). Not only was the food bad and service poor, but when I tried to redeem the points, I was told I had to do that at home and bring a voucher in? Seriously? In addition, their wifi wasn't working, so I couldn't redeem online either. I informed our server that was the only reason we came, and she said "too bad".  Maybe you should come back!  I think not, and hope anyone reading this review agrees!

I have to say that I had a great experience here. The staff was friendly , the seating is quick and the deserts are YUMMY! I enjoy coming here for dinner with my girls because its so fun! The drinks are always delicious and the deserts as well. I have no complaints except maybe they should extend their menu a bit.

I went to TGI Fridays with a 2 for 1 Entree Coupon, and still feel ripped off!  I'd only recommend taking a date here if you plan on breaking up with them. - 25 minute wait - for what?  This place was terrible at turning  over tables.  When we sat down, we noticed six or seven tables constantly open on a place that seats 50.    - Cramped, I mean really cramped.  You have people sitting on top of you for the most part.  This is supposed to be a "sports" atmosphere, but the bar area here is glassed off because they still allow smoking.  One thing I liked about other TGI Friday's locations is you could go in and grab a burger, beer, and watch a game - not here.  Can't see the TVs from the rest of the restaurant. - They have this Jack Daniels entree menu, and for $18 you don't get a salad included.   - Most burgers taste better than the "Strip" steak I got - I love steak and didn't want to finish more than half of it.  It was like eating chewing gum - My wife had a chicken dish that was below average, I'd compare it to a rubber chicken dish at a convention center. The only positives was our waitress wasn't terrible, even though the kitchen was very slow, and their beer is reasonably priced.  The whole meal was still too expensive, even after what I thought was a good discount.

What can I say? I am a fan of Fridays - love their Jack Daniels burger.  Also I'm a big fan of the chicken and shrimp Cajun pasta and strawberry shortcake.  My biggest complaint is that they don't keep their best items on the menu.  They used to have and awesome chicken popper sandwich with this Habanero sauce on it that was amazing, a really good bacon wrapped scallops and Texas toast, excellent fish tacos, and more, but now - all gone.  Still, I prefer the variety over Chilis and the quality over Applebees, so if you are going to choose a chain restaurant, you could do a lot worse.

Ohh my goodness I have never tasted such worse white chicken chili in my life... if that's what you can call it. Looked like some regurgitated nachos in a bowl with a crusty film on top nasty!!! minus 1 star for that! and minus one star of the manager continuing to ask me why I didn't like it? have I ever had it before? and again Why I didn't like it over and over again!!  Dude!! would you eat something that looked like that? on a plus side he did bring me another bowl of soup.. broccoli and cheese which was much better!

It is O.K.  I am not a big fan of corporate chain restaurants.  But this Kennesaw location of TGI Fridays can work in a pinch.  Food is O.K.  You can get a good beer here, especially on tap.  Even, though this is an all-ages establishment, you can smoke in the bar area because it is completely segregated from the main dining area and only patrons 21 years of age and older can be in there at any time the restaurant is open.  Georgia does have a smoking ban law that has been in place since late 2005.  But it is a lot more flexible than, say, Massachusetts, which is where I am from orginally.  The law only generally covers restaurants that admit customers of all ages.  Bars, clubs and lounges that are limited to those 21 are exempt.  This TGI Fridays is one of those full service restaurants that can have a smoking section beacuse it is completely seperated from the completely non-smoking main dining room and 21 and older only admitted.  Nice to have that kind of flexibility.  At the bar, you can also catch a good game on TV.

We went in and immediately sat down, even though there were people standing around and sitting outside. Our server came over after about a minute and asked for our drink order. I noticed that he spoke rather quickly and was in a hurry. He came back with our drinks, took our order and left. The food was okay...nothing great or outstanding. Our server was hurried and we really didn't understand what he was saying. He did however keep our drinks filled, which is good because if my wife's water gets empty, it's not pretty! My son got the wings and he said that they were not very good because they didn't have a good taste to them. He should know, he gets wings everywhere we go. My wife's shrimp and steamed broccoli was okay and my Roasted Red Pepper Sausage and Chicken Penne was okay also, although neither was hot. We don't go here often but my son wanted to try it again, so we went. We probably won't go back for awhile, if at all.

When in on a Thursday night are they running a restaurant or a night club. Music way to loud can't even hear yourself think or have a conversation should have looked on yelp first l have never given one star at a restaurant won't be back

We went to this restaurant for the first time in a few years. We went for the unlimited apps. The food was excellent. The waiter was very helpful in explaining how the menu worked. The first 2 items we ordered were full sized. Subsiquent items were half size. One of the first things we ordered were the Potato skins. With 8 to the order, it was very filling. Next time, we will order the boneless wings or meatballs. Don't panic when you see the check. They list the full price of the food, and then deduct it.

This place was awful. Dirty, unorganized, slow. Don't go here. From the moment we walked in was a series of ineptness. Three hosts and not a one of them could even think of taking a name for a wait list. Then they called my name before the couple in front of us. No clue as to them being ahead of us even thought they had just taken their name. They were out of menus! How can you be out of menus? Took forever. People got up and left. I got an appetizer and the food and plate was messy. The manager only came out once and she walked around the perimeter of the restaurant and then just went back into the back. We Weill never go back here

One of the times I wish I could put less than a star. Terrible experience overall. Honestly, we had a coupon for a free entree with purchase of regular entree and two drinks so we thought we would have a pretty good experience. One order was a chicken sandwich which we thought was a burger due to the coloring and texture but it was a severely over cooked chicken sandwich that you could not even bite through. Service was awful on top of that. We were comped the chicken sandwich but there is not much of a way to come back from this. Will not be going back. Gives the word Friday a bad name.
A nice TGIF just off I 75.   Happenin DJ this Friday night.  Staff was very attentive.

Never really have the best experience here. Food is NEVER hot ! Especially if you order unlimited apps. They give you a hot plate with cold/ warm food. The staff is okay. I wouldn't spend my money with this place again. Sadly I keep trying to give them a chance as if it'll be better the next time and the last 5x has been horrible. I shouldn't feel like I just wasted my money

Bottomless Appetizers are the best!!!  A few co workers and I met up for Happy Hour one evening after work. This particular day they were running the Jack Daniels drink specials. I'm not a big Jack Daniels fan, but the drinks were on point. We were seated in the bar area, and our bartender/server was awesome!!!! She suggested this great drink from the drink menu, and kept our apps coming, we ordered pot sticker, potato skins and boneless wings. Yum!!  We are thinking of making it our Tuesday spot.  Lol

I rarely visit TGIF's because its a bit of a trek for me, living near Dunwoody,  when theres the comparable Chili's and Applebee's nearby. But...last Saturday I received a bogo entree coupon in my email from them, and decided to give it a go. When we arrived it was very packed, a big turn off for me. They said it would be a 15 minute wait. I understood, and before the 15 minutes were up, we were called in. Seated nearby the bar, but directly behind the hostess, we waited a bit for a waitress. We had to alert the hostess, because it had been a good 10 minutes and our waitress scooted on over quickly and apologized.  By that time we knew what we wanted. Drinks followed shortly.  We ordered and our deep fried greenbeans came first, in which they we delicious, but they don't give you enough sabe ranch sauce. I recommend you ask for extra if you order this hors d'oeuvre. Our burgers came out wonderfully. Grilled to order exactly how we requested. Our bill came and they honored the BOGO meal. Our waitress also compt our fried green beans due to the wait. We will be back TGIF's! Since I used the BOGO coupon they sent me another coupon for 20% off my next meal. Way to go! Very happy experience!

If I could give this TGI Friday's 10 stars I would still want to give more! I had such a great time for lunch and the service was absolutely AMAZING  Felicia and Prince were the best servers I've truly ever had in my life! If you come, service with anyone would be great but I had these two & I had so much fun! I'll definitely be back soon. Loved this place

Wow really we were traveling to TN and stopped by after getting throughAtlanta traffic and stopped in for a small bite. When I walked in their was a DJ right inside the door with a laptop and speaker playing music so unbelievably loud. The hostess couldn't hear me shout to put us at the farthest table from the music. We sat down and we're greeted by Sugar. She was a great server and took care of us immediately and quickly.  I don't think I will return to a Friday's again due to this.

Horrible service!!!  Got a coupon in the mail...haven't been there in years...decided to give it a try again...walked out after sitting at the bar for 15+ minutes without any service...bartenders seemed very bias(& thats putting it nicely) & unconcerned about waiting on us...we'll never go back...i can see why they were sending out coupons but coupons don't help if service sucks & no one wants to wait on you!

So I decide to dine here for lunch on a Saturday.  I ordered a watermelon cooler for my drink and the waiter asked for me ID.  I had absolutely no problem showing my ID for my alcoholic beverage.  Then once he checked my ID he asked for me for my date of birth.  I told him its on my ID.  He then said that TGI Fridays has a new policy that you have to verbally recite your DOB!!!!!!!! Are you kidding me.?!!!!!!  I have never heard of such a thing.  This is utterly ridiculous that I would need to say my DOB out loud when it is clearly on my GA state license.  For one, have a training on how to identify a false ID if that's the ultimate goal.  And second,  I feel like that's a violation of my privacy.  TGI Friday's if this is truly your new policy you need to reconsider.  I will not be back.  And I will be calling the corporate office to verify this and voice my opinion.

This location has recently updated to a more open, sexy, and spacious decor. The service is excellent. The food is good. Try the shrimp, sizzling chicken, loaded potatoes, and whiskey cake. Wash it down with one of their thirst quenching flavored lemonades. Yummm

Crappy service... Host sat us at a table with sticky stuff on the floor.  Then we sat there for 15 munutes before waitress took our drink order. She spologized saying this table was not assigned to anyone. Drinks came 15 minutes later. It was a dead wednesday night and there were more employees milling around than dinners seated. There was no excuse for terrible service.  Management should be ashamed.

They wouldn't take our money.  Took the family here last Sat night since we have a gift card.  At 8:30pm, the parking lot was half-full and it was easy to park.  Walked in and asked for a table for 5...."It will be a 35-minute wait."  Are you freaking kidding me?  Just turn around and LOOK inside your restaurant.  Half the tables are either EMPTY or need to be cleaned off and we're the only customers who have to wait for a table?  It never ceases to amaze me how people working the front of these restaurants run people off.  If I owned TGIF, she would've been fired on the spot for incompetence.  TGIF, Chili's, Applebees, etc are in an intensely competitive niche market.  Turning people away at the door when your restaurant has plenty of empty tables is exactly how you LOSE the war in that market.  Our TGIF gift card will now become a Christmas present for someone else to deal with....

The wait was terrible. The hostess tried to seat us at a table then walked us around until she settled for a half booth. The waiter took forever especially with drinks and disappeared. Another server came to take our order after noticing ours had disappeared. The food was disgusting with the tartar sauce for the fish and chips tasting anything but fresh. By the end of our meal we had asked for one to go box to only again have to wait around forever. Then the waiter finally comes back and just dumps it and wanders off again. Leaving us to again wait for him to bring the check and to then pick it up. Will never come back, especially not this location. Don't waste the time.

Came in tonight to get a drink after a 12 hour work day. It took 5 minutes to get seated, and then 10 minutes for waiter to show up. All to be told they won't serve me alcohol, because (at22) my ID isn't valid to them because I haven't updated it to the new version. I've never had this issue at a restaurant or even TGI Friday's before, but I will not be returning. Horrible service and stupid policy.
Throwback Thursday's are NOT Living up to the name at all!! Okay music, friendly staff ... but don't come here expecting to hear classics or even 90's tracks

We came here around 2:30 and it wasn't very busy. They seat everyone in the middle so it appears to look crowded. The service was pretty slow. I only saw about 2 waitresses and they were running all over the place trying to maintain their customers. We didn't see much of our waitress but when she was around she was very nice and helpful.  I ordered the jack Daniels half rack of runs with fries and coleslaw. We waited about 20 mins for our food which wasn't too bad since 4/5 of us got ribs. The food was great! Everyone enjoyed everything. The ribs are the best here!  If you use to come here for the Guinness Shake, forget it. They don't have Guinness on draft anymore. Their bathrooms were kinda gross too. There was a missing handle and water everywhere. Plus it was sticky on the floors. The strawberry lemonade tasted like it came from a powder, so wouldn't recommend it.  Overall we had a good experience here so I don't know why the reviews are so bad. They have free wifi!

Been here twice and both bad experiences, thought I would give them another chance - failed miserably to both me and both my guests.  Embarrassing me so much after wrong drink orders, 40 min wait to get food at 9 pm at night for 3 people and still getting the food ice cold.  I had the Jack Daniels Steak, Ribs and Shrimp (steak was supposed to be well done - RAW in middle as was the SHRIMP - HOW BAD DO YOU HAVE TO BE TO SCREW THAT UP?!?!).  One guys fish was ice cold on bottom, so it sat in the heat lamp how long?   No seasoning on anything, just poured over the Jack Daniels sauce - vegetables were hardly cooked.  We mostly just got everything to go which our waitress never had a clue when I stated very bluntly that I thought we could cook them at home better or use them for dog food. Manager never came over to check on us and even after we sent food back.  Paid the check and left as I didn't want to argue with the manager in front of the 3 others.  Called even to the 1800 # and registered the complaint, they told me a manager would call, never did.  Great reason to never come back again.  To add insult to injury one of my guests was a Federal Agent and the waitress said if he had a gun he wasn't allowed?!?!  IDIOTS!!!
